intro: Streptocarpus exsertus, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its unique flower structure features spurred petals, which aid in pollination by attracting specific insect pollinators. Streptocarpus exsertus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
